title: What is the worst Katy Perry song? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Bon Appetit.” After a lot of thinking, this is the song I chose. Why not “Birthday,” “Swish Swish,” or “Rise?” Well, while I may not be a fan of ANY of those songs (“Birthday” is often dubbed the sequel to “Last Friday Night,” but it’s a letdown of a sequel, in my opinion), “Bon Appetit” is just the worst. Boring lyrics, not very sexy (I’m fine with songs not being sexy, but considering that “Bon Appetit” is supposed to be, I thought I needed to add that), and it has a lame music video. One listen to that song and you’ll automatically know that it was written to appeal to modern day and tried very hard to be ‘trendy.’ I prefer Katy Perry songs that she wrote because she wanted to and she enjoyed them, not songs that she writes just to have an album so she doesn’t become irrelevant.
My friend banned her pre-teen daughter from all Katy Perry music after listening to her unsuspecting daughter sing along cheerfully to the catchy song “Peacock”.
Who Am I Living For? This is by far the worst Katy Perry song from teenage dream album . With its overproduction and off beat, it’s always a skip from me. It also does not fit into the album sound.
I Love her all her songs, I don’t know of a bad song.
I think *Never Worn White* because I was never really into love songs.
